post.summary: Show applications. Any fields specified will be used to filter results.
Show application instances. Any fields specified will be used to filter results.
Show all Nodes connected to all Controllers

public_port.title: Public facing port for TCP/UDP (may be mapped on shared LB reverse proxy)

public_path.description: Public facing path for HTTP L7 access.

distributed_match_engineAppPort.description: AppPort describes an L4 or L7 public access port/path mapping. This is used to track external to internal mappings for access via a shared load balancer or reverse proxy.

distributed_match_engineLProto.description:
LProto indicates which protocol to use for accessing an application on a particular port. This is required by Kubernetes for port mapping.

 - LProtoUnknown: Unknown protocol
 - LProtoTCP: TCP (L4) protocol
 - LProtoUDP: UDP (L4) protocol
 - LProtoHTTP: HTTP (L7 tcp) protocol

altitude.title:
On android only lat and long are guaranteed to be supplied
altitude in meters

course.title: course (IOS) / bearing (Android) (degrees east relative to true north)

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

image_path.title: URI from which to download image

access_ports.description:
For Layer4 access, the ports the app listens on.
This is a comma separated list of protocol:port pairs, i.e.
tcp:80,http:443,udp:10002.
Only tcp, udp, and http protocols are supported; tcp and udp are assumed
to be L4, and http is assumed to be L7 access.

config.description: URI of resource to be used to establish config for App.

default_flavor.title: Default flavor for the App, may be overridden by the AppInst

cluster.description:
Cluster on which the App can be instantiated.
If not specified during create, a cluster will be automatically created.
If specified, it must exist.

app_template.description:
Template of kubernetes deployment yaml.
Who/What sets this is TDB, but it should not be directly
exposed to the user, because we do not want to expose
kubernetes to the user. However, because we currently don't have any
other way to set it, for flexibility, for now it is exposed to the user.

edgeprotoApp.description:
Apps are applications that may be instantiated on Cloudlets, providing a back-end service to an application client (using the mobiledgex SDK) running on a user device such as a cell phone, wearable, drone, etc. Applications belong to Developers, and must specify their image and accessibility. Applications are analagous to Pods in Kubernetes, and similarly are tied to a Cluster.
An application in itself is not tied to a Cloudlet, but provides a definition that can be used to instantiate it on a Cloudlet. AppInsts are applications instantiated on a particular Cloudlet.

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

uri.title: URI to connect to this instance

cluster_inst_key.title: Cluster instance on which this is instatiated (not specifiable by user)

mapped_ports.description:
For instances accessible via a shared load balancer, defines the external
ports on the shared load balancer that map to the internal ports
External ports should be appended to the Uri for L4 access.

ip_access.title: IP access type. If set to SharedOrDedicated on App, one will be chosen for AppInst

state.title: Current state of the AppInst on the Cloudlet

errors.title: Any errors trying to create, update, or delete the AppInst on the Cloudlet

edgeprotoAppInst.description:
AppInst is an instance of an App (application) on a Cloudlet. It is defined by an App plus a Cloudlet key. This separation of the definition of the App versus its instantiation is unique to Mobiledgex, and allows the Developer to provide the App defintion, while either the Developer may statically define the instances, or the Mobiledgex platform may dynamically create and destroy instances in response to demand.
When an application is instantiated on a Cloudlet, the user may override the default Flavor of the application. This allows for an instance in one location to be provided more resources than an instance in other locations, in expectation of different demands in different locations.
Many of the fields here are inherited from the App definition. Some are derived, like the mapped ports field, depending upon if the AppInst accessibility is via a shared or dedicated load balancer.

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

notify_id.title: Id of client assigned by server (internal use only)

state.title: Current state of the AppInst on the Cloudlet

errors.title: Any errors trying to create, update, or delete the AppInst on the Cloudlet

edgeprotoAppInstInfo.description: AppInstInfo provides information from the Cloudlet Resource Manager about the state of the AppInst on the Cloudlet. Whereas the AppInst defines the intent of instantiating an App on a Cloudlet, the AppInstInfo defines the current state of trying to apply that intent on the physical resources of the Cloudlet.

cloudlet_key.title: Cloudlet on which the App is instantiated

id.title: Instance id for defining multiple instances of the same App on the same Cloudlet (not supported yet)

edgeprotoAppInstKey.description: AppInstKey uniquely identifies an Application Instance (AppInst) or Application Instance state (AppInstInfo).

something.description:
what goes here?
Note that metrics for grpc calls can be done by a prometheus
interceptor in grpc, so adding call metrics here may be
redundant unless they're needed for billing.

edgeprotoAppInstMetrics.description: (TODO) AppInstMetrics provide metrics collected about the application instance on the Cloudlet. They are sent to a metrics collector for analytics. They are not stored in the persistent distributed database, but are stored as a time series in some other database or files.

edgeprotoCRMOverride.description:
CRMOverride can be applied to commands that issue requests to the CRM.
It should only be used by administrators when bugs have caused the
Controller and CRM to get out of sync. It allows commands from the
Controller to ignore errors from the CRM, or ignore the CRM completely
(messages will not be sent to CRM).

 - NoOverride: No override
 - IgnoreCRMErrors: Ignore errors from CRM
 - IgnoreCRM: Ignore CRM completely (does not inform CRM of operation)
 - IgnoreTransientState: Ignore Transient State (only admin should use if CRM crashed)
 - IgnoreCRMandTransientState: Ignore CRM and Transient State

access_ip.description:
AccessIp should come from the cloudlet, but for testing it
is configurable here. This will need to be removed later.

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

access_uri.description: URI to use to connect to and create and administer the Cloudlet. This is not the URI for applications clients to access their back-end instances.

ip_support.title: Type of IP support provided by Cloudlet (see IpSupport)

static_ips.title: List of static IPs for static IP support

num_dynamic_ips.title: Number of dynamic IPs available for dynamic IP support

edgeprotoCloudlet.description:
A Cloudlet is a set of compute resources at a particular location, typically an Operator's regional data center, or a cell tower. The Cloudlet is managed by a Cloudlet Resource Manager, which communicates with the Mobiledgex Controller and allows AppInsts (application instances) to be instantiated on the Cloudlet.
A Cloudlet will be created by either a Mobiledgex admin or an Operator that provides the Cloudlet.

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

notify_id.title: Id of client assigned by server (internal use only)

os_max_ram.title: Maximum Ram in MB on the Cloudlet

os_max_vcores.title: Maximum number of VCPU cores on the Cloudlet

os_max_vol_gb.title: Maximum amount of disk in GB on the Cloudlet

errors.title: Any errors encountered while making changes to the Cloudlet

edgeprotoCloudletInfo.description: CloudletInfo provides information from the Cloudlet Resource Manager about the state of the Cloudlet.

edgeprotoCloudletMetrics.description: (TODO) CloudletMetrics provide metrics collected about the Cloudlet. They are sent to a metrics collector for analytics. They are not stored in the persistent distributed database, but are stored as a time series in some other database or files.

root_lb_ports.description: Used ports on root load balancer. Map key is public port, value is unused.

edgeprotoCloudletRefs.description: CloudletRefs track used resources and Clusters instantiated on a Cloudlet. Used resources are compared against max resources for a Cloudlet to determine if resources are available for a new Cluster to be instantiated on the Cloudlet.

edgeprotoCloudletState.description:
CloudletState is the state of the Cloudlet.

 - CloudletStateUnknown: Unknown
 - CloudletStateErrors: Create/Delete/Update encountered errors (see Errors field of CloudletInfo)
 - CloudletStateReady: Cloudlet is created and ready
 - CloudletStateOffline: Cloudlet is offline (unreachable)
 - CloudletStateNotPresent: Cloudlet is not present

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

default_flavor.title: Default flavor of the Cluster, may be overridden on the ClusterInst

auto.title: Auto is set to true when automatically created by back-end (internal use only)

edgeprotoCluster.description:
Clusters define a set of resources that are provided to one or more Apps tied to the cluster. The set of resources is defined by the Cluster flavor. The Cluster definition here is analogous to a Kubernetes cluster.
Like Apps, a Cluster is merely a definition, but is not instantiated on any Cloudlets. ClusterInsts are Clusters instantiated on a particular Cloudlet.
In comparison to ClusterFlavors which are fairly static and controller by administrators, Clusters are much more dynamic and created and deleted by the user.

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

node_flavor.title: Flavor of each node in the Cluster

master_flavor.title: Flavor of each master node in the Cluster

num_nodes.title: Initial number of nodes in the Cluster

max_nodes.title: Maximum number of nodes allowed in the Cluster (for auto-scaling)

num_masters.title: Number of master nodes in the Cluster

edgeprotoClusterFlavor.description: ClusterFlavor defines a set of resources for a Cluster. ClusterFlavors should be fairly static objects that are almost never changed, and are only modified by Mobiledgex administrators.

edgeprotoClusterFlavorKey.description: ClusterFlavorKey uniquely identifies a Cluster Flavor.

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

auto.title: Auto is set to true when automatically created by back-end (internal use only)

errors.description: Any errors trying to create, update, or delete the ClusterInst on the Cloudlet.

edgeprotoClusterInst.description:
ClusterInst is an instance of a Cluster on a Cloudlet. It is defined by a Cluster plus a Cloudlet key. This separation of the definition of the Cluster versus its instance is unique to Mobiledgex, and allows the Developer to provide the Cluster definition, while either the Developer may statically define the instances, or the Mobiledgex platform may dynamically create and destroy instances in response to demand.
When a Cluster is instantiated on a Cloudlet, the user may override the default ClusterFlavor of the Cluster. This allows for an instance in one location to be provided more resources than an instance in other locations, in expectation of different demands in different locations.

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

notify_id.title: Id of client assigned by server (internal use only)

errors.description: Any errors trying to create, update, or delete the ClusterInst on the Cloudlet.

edgeprotoClusterInstInfo.description: ClusterInstInfo provides information from the Cloudlet Resource Manager about the state of the ClusterInst on the Cloudlet. Whereas the ClusterInst defines the intent of instantiating a Cluster on a Cloudlet, the ClusterInstInfo defines the current state of trying to apply that intent on the physical resources of the Cloudlet.

cloudlet_key.title: Cloudlet on which the Cluster is instantiated

edgeprotoClusterInstKey.description: ClusterInstKey uniquely identifies a Cluster Instance (ClusterInst) or Cluster Instance state (ClusterInstInfo).

apps.title: Apps instances in the Cluster Instance

edgeprotoClusterRefs.description: ClusterRefs track used resources within a ClusterInst. Each AppInst specifies a set of required resources (Flavor), so tracking resources used by Apps within a Cluster is necessary to determine if enough resources are available for another AppInst to be instantiated on a ClusterInst.

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

edgeprotoController.description: A Controller is a service that manages the edge-cloud data and controls other edge-cloud micro-services.

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

edgeprotoDeveloper.description:
A Developer defines a Mobiledgex customer that can create and manage applications, clusters, instances, etc. Applications and other objects created by one Developer cannot be seen or managed by other Developers. Billing will likely be done on a per-developer basis.
Creating a developer identity is likely the first step of (self-)registering a new customer.
TODO: user management, auth, etc is not implemented yet.

edgeprotoDeveloperKey.title: DeveloperKey uniquely identifies a Developer (Mobiledgex customer)

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

edgeprotoFlavor.description: A Flavor identifies the Cpu, Ram, and Disk resources required for either a node in a Cluster, or an application instance. For a node in a cluster, these are the physical resources provided by that node. For an application instance, this defines the resources (per node) that should be allocated to the instance from the Cluster.

edgeprotoImageType.description:
ImageType specifies the image type of the application.

 - ImageTypeUnknown: Unknown image type
 - ImageTypeDocker: Docker container image type compatible with Kubernetes
 - ImageTypeQCOW: QCOW2 virtual machine image type

edgeprotoIpAccess.title:
- IpAccessUnknown: Unknown IP access
 - IpAccessDedicated: Dedicated IP access
 - IpAccessDedicatedOrShared: Dedicated or shared (prefers dedicated) access
 - IpAccessShared: Shared IP access

edgeprotoIpSupport.description:
IpSupport indicates the type of public IP support provided by the Cloudlet. Static IP support indicates a set of static public IPs are available for use, and managed by the Controller. Dynamic indicates the Cloudlet uses a DHCP server to provide public IP addresses, and the controller has no control over which IPs are assigned.

 - IpSupportUnknown: Unknown IP support
 - IpSupportStatic: Static IP addresses are provided to and managed by Controller
 - IpSupportDynamic: IP addresses are dynamically provided by an Operator's DHCP server

edgeprotoLiveness.description:
Liveness indicates if an object was created statically via an external API call, or dynamically via an internal algorithm.

 - LivenessUnknown: Unknown liveness
 - LivenessStatic: Object managed by external entity
 - LivenessDynamic: Object managed internally

timestamp.title: Timestamp when the metric was captured

tags.title: Tags associated with the metric for searching/filtering

edgeprotoMetric.description: Metric is an entry/point in a time series of values for Analytics/Billing.

edgeprotoMetricTag.description: MetricTag is used as a tag or label to look up the metric, beyond just the name of the metric.

edgeprotoMetricVal.description: MetricVal is a value associated with the metric.

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

notify_id.title: Id of client assigned by server (internal use only)

edgeprotoNode.description: Node defines a DME (distributed matching engine) or CRM (cloudlet resource manager) instance.

cloudlet_key.title: Cloudlet on which node is running, or is associated with

edgeprotoNodeKey.title: NodeKey uniquely identifies a DME or CRM node

edgeprotoNodeType.description:
- NodeUnknown: Unknown
 - NodeDME: Distributed Matching Engine
 - NodeCRM: Cloudlet Resource Manager
edgeprotoNodeType.title: NodeType defines the type of Node

edgeprotoNoticeAction.description:
NoticeAction denotes what kind of action this notification is for.

 - NONE: No action
 - UPDATE: Update the object
 - DELETE: Delete the object
 - VERSION: Version exchange negotitation message
 - SENDALL_END: Initial send all finished message

edgeprotoNoticeReply.description: NoticyReply is sent from server to client.

edgeprotoNoticeRequestor.description:
NoticeRequestor indicates which type of service the client is.

 - NoticeRequestorNone: Invalid
 - NoticeRequestorDME: Distributed Matching Engine
 - NoticeRequestorCRM: Cloudlet Resource Manager

fields.title: Fields are used for the Update API to specify which fields to apply

edgeprotoOperator.description: An Operator defines a telecommunications provider such as AT&T, T-Mobile, etc. The operators in turn provide Mobiledgex with compute resource Cloudlets that serve as the basis for location-based services.

name.title: Company or Organization name of the operator

message.title: Message, may be success or failure message

code.title: Error code, 0 indicates success, non-zero indicates failure (not implemented)

edgeprotoResult.description: Result is a generic object for returning the result of an API call. In general, result is not used. The error value returned by the GRPC API call is used instead.

edgeprotoTrackedState.description:
TrackedState is used to track the state of an object on a remote node,
i.e. track the state of a ClusterInst object on the CRM (Cloudlet).

 - TrackedStateUnknown: Unknown state
 - NotPresent: Not present (does not exist)
 - CreateRequested: Create requested
 - Creating: Creating
 - CreateError: Create error
 - Ready: Ready
 - UpdateRequested: Update requested
 - Updating: Updating
 - UpdateError: Update error
 - DeleteRequested: Delete requested
 - Deleting: Deleting
 - DeleteError: Delete error
